import numpy as np
import pandas as pd

# Load official MNIST training and test set
from keras.datasets import mnist
(x_train, y_train), (x_val, y_val) = mnist.load_data()

# Concatenate the official training and test set to increase your training set by 70,000 examples
x_train = np.vstack([x_train, x_val])
y_train = np.concatenate((y_train,y_val),axis=0)

# Load the digit recognizer test set
test_path="../input/digit-recognizer/test.csv"
test= pd.read_csv(test_path)

# Normalize the data
x_train = x_train / 255.0
test = test / 255.0

# Reshape image in 3 dimensions (height = 28px, width = 28px, canal = 1)
x_train = x_train.reshape(-1,28,28,1)
test = test.values.reshape(-1,28,28,1)
